intro: Dicoma vaginata, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of branches. Dicoma vaginata is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
